alert.note: Alert for Burnet (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:47PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Burnet County through 730 PM CDT... At 647 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burnet, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burnet, Bertram and Oatmeal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
